doc.headline: The A2K World Cup 2006 Striker Fantasy Game
doc.post:
The Football (soccer) World Cup in Germany starts in 2 weeks. It's time to play another A2K Fantasy Game.
The simple rules of the game:
1. Each participant chooses 5 footballers who will play in Germany 2006, and orders them from 1 to 5.
2. Every goal scored from this players will mean points to the participant. 5 points for player number 1; 4 points for player number 2; 3 points for player number 3; 2 points for player number 4 and 1 point for player number 5.
3. The game will be held in 3 stages: Stage 1: group rounds - first 48 games Stage 2: second round and quarter finals - 12 games Stage 3: semi-finals, game for 3rd place and final - 4 games
4. The list of strikers for Stage 1, and their order, can be changed for Stage 2 and, again, for Stage 3. If a new list is not provided before a stage kick-off, the original list will be taken as confirmed for that stage.
5. The winner is the participant who scores the most points.
6. There will be 4 winners. One for each stage and one for the total tournament.
7. Tiebreak system: If two or more players end a stage or the tournament with the same number of points, the tie break will follow this criteria: I. The participant whose strikers scored more goals, regardless of the order in the list. II. The participant whose strikers scored more headers (goals with the head). III. The participant whose strikers scored less goals from penalty kicks. (the eleven step PK).
8. No player can duplicate a previous poster team. There should be at least one difference (in the order or in the list itself).
Prizes: Stage winners: Virtual gold medal Tournament winner: Virtual FIFA Cup Tournament runner-up: Virtual silver cup.
--- an example will be given in the next post ---

EXAMPLE WITH (OBVIOUSLY) FAKE PLAYERS:
1. De Kere (BRA) 2. Ellpus (ENG) 3. Hinteler (GER) 4. Nation (USA) 5. Lowan (AUS)
Any goal by De Kere is worth 5 points Any goal by Ellpus is worth 4 points Any goal by Hinteler is worth 3 points Any goal by Nation is worth 2 points Any goal by Lowan is worth 1 point
---
Your list should be with REAL footballers. If they do not participate in the World Cup, we'll tell you.
----
DEADLINES:
The deadline for participation for Stage 1 (key to win the tournament) is the moment of the Germany-Costa Rica kick-off, June 9th, 18:00 German time. The deadline for participation for Stage 2 is June 24th, 17:00 German time. The deadline for participation for Stage 3 is July 4th, 21:00 German time.

Will there be a draft?
Or will we just choose our 5 players at the same time?
A draft, LOL!
BM
Bootmark.
No draft. Everyone can have Jamba, from Angola, if they want; or Ronaldinho, for that matter. The only limit is that you cannot copy other fellow's list.
Oh! That make infinitely more sense...
studmark

Since I started the thread, I'll be the first to post my list:
1. Shevchenko (UKR) 2. Ibrahimovic (SWE) 3. Klose (GER) 4. Adriano (BRA) 5. Owen (ENG)

Here's mine:
Podolski (GER) Fonseca (MEX) Raul (ESP) Baros (CZE) Babel (NED)

I'm gambling on certain players making hay in the earlier games aganst the so-called weaker nations. For example, England and Sweden should score plenty of goals against Trinidad and Tobago, while I'd expect Switzerland and South Korea to inflict similar damage on Togo.
Crouch (England) Henrik Larsson (Sweden) Frei (Switzerland) Lee Chun-soo (South Korea) Adriano (Brazil)

My goal is to learn by following this thread...

I might do a pool and then select random names.
Osso, you should pick forwards out of the teams (or countries) you like. With the unpredictability of the world cup, you could even win the pool.
Just find the strongest striker in the strongest team in the least even pools. And hope the coach doesn't rest them for later rounds...
Crespo (Argentina) Ronaldo (Brazil) Drogba (Cote d'Ivoire) Pauleta (Portugal) Donovan (USA)...yeah, yeah...I know...

Well, I think that with this game in mind you might learn a lil' bit about the game George. And if you don't, its anyway fun.
And talking about not knowing so much about soccer, there's some research from some guy in Berlin that found out that people that know a little bit about soccer were as good as "experts" in predicting the outcome of the last Euro Cup.
And totally off-topic and for those who can read spanish I wrote in my blog about my experience in the first day of the world cup (WC) in a little university town in Germany: Noticias del Frente

I just found out that I can't win this phase.
If my Adriano scores, Lord Ellpus will get 3 more points than me for each goal.
If Shevchenko scores, I only recover 1 point from both Pantalones and Patada Veloz, and I'm behind by 8 points. No way Shevchenko can score 9 goals in a game (and that's supposing El Niño can't get any).
----
George needs Crespo to do a double, and Pauleta too (let's hope not), he has slightly more chances than myself, but it'll be hard for him to leave the pack. Sheo_mac and ossobuco need a hat trick from Van Nistelrooj, or at least a couple, plus assorted goals by Pauleta (God forbid!), Raúl or Gilardino. From improbable to impossible. Imur needs Frei and Shun-soo to go wild on their game. His chances for this round are also very slim. hingehead needs Fonseca to score a couple (please, God!), Ronaldo and Raúl to do the same and Baros and Babel to play and show their stuff. Also doomed, IMHO.
---
So the deal is between Patada Veloz, Pantalones & Lord Ellpus. The key for Patada Veloz is Torres NOT to score. A goal by Baros or Ronaldinho would be additional help, but not crucial. The key for Pantalones is Torres to score. A goal by Henry can make him surpass Patada, but would help Lord Ellpus even more. The key player for Ellpus is Adriano. One goal by the Brazilian, and the English Lord is on the lead. Toni can be of marginal help. And Ellpus must pray that neither Shevchenko nor Torres score against those mighty moors.

5+4+9+8 = 22?

I shall write to my Member of Parliament, first thing in the morning!
That's the Mexican way of adding! (see, both Pantalones and Patada Veloz are Mexican) :wink:

About the rules of the game, a reminder:
"3. The game will be held in 3 stages: Stage 1: group rounds - first 48 games Stage 2: second round and quarter finals - 12 games Stage 3: semi-finals, game for 3rd place and final - 4 games
4. The list of strikers for Stage 1, and their order, can be changed for Stage 2 and, again, for Stage 3. If a new list is not provided before a stage kick-off, the original list will be taken as confirmed for that stage. "
This means you can change your strikers until before the start of the game between Germany and Sweden. You can get rid of your eliminated, injured or out-of-key player, change the order, get even, etc. The game is open for any newcomer (who can certainly win a stage, but has a handicap against for the whole tournament points).
The window for changes is open now (they will not take effect until Saturday June 24th).
Osso, I'm so sorry I'm not propping up the table any more.
That's all right, hinge, I was expecting demotion. And I'm glad Fonseca got a goal.. Viva Mexico!

hingehead would've had at least 4 more points, IMHO, had Mexican coach Lavolpe not insisted in his favorite, useless, Guille Franco.
This has to do, I think, with Fonseca openly sponsoring, in political ads, the conservative presidential candidate, and Lavolpe not liking it.
Wow! I didn't know that - politics and sport. Strange bedfellows.

Wow! I didn't know that - politics and sport. Strange bedfellows.
Strange indeed. And not healthy.
Some pollsters say that the football squad may help decide a very close election.
The election is on July 2nd. If the team is still alive, it will help the incumbent party. Several football players and ex-players, led by Fonseca, have contributed to the "Mexico Winner" campaign of the conservatives. The populist candidate, the main contender, instead, focuses on the things that lack in our country... and likes baseball. Coach Lavolpe reacted by declaring that "Kikin" (Fonseca) reads tabloids and doesn't know what he says. It caused a stir right before the tournament. It was only Borgetti's injury and Franco's terrible performances that forced Lavolpe to start Fonseca (even if he, not Bravo, was considered the natural companion of Borgetti in Mexico's offense).
I now it's off topic but Fox is Presidente? And the opposing candidate is leftish? - so the US is no doubt quivering that another latin american country is moving to the left?

OK, a digression.
Fox is the President. Calderón is the candidate of Fox's party. López Obrador is the populist candidate who is head to head with Calderón. Madrazo (third place) is the candidate of the former ruling party. I am voting for Mercado, the Socialdemocrat candidate in 4th place. There's another candidate, Campa, with 1% in the polls.
The US is indeed quivering.
Aaack!

The PAN, I know, is conservative. Obrador is leftist/populist. What is the name of his party? What is the PRI, then? Centrist?
Who do you think will win, fbaezer?

Darn, infrablue, I thought you were joining the game!
López Obrador is a member of PRD (Party of the Democratic Revolution) and runs for a coalition denominated Coalition for Everybody's Good.
The PRI is a typical Mexican monster. Ideologically left-of-center; practically right-of-center.
I think Brazil will win against Japan.

One small question. Though Schevchenko didn't score his penalty kick, What about the strikers that do? Would those goals be tallied or not? My confusion arose from looking at the world cup web page, there they say that the last striker was Totti, World Cup (sorry guys, the link is to the Spanish version). Personally I believe that the PK goals should be tallied (I actually chose my guys because I believe that if there are PK they will shoot one;).
Totti's was in general play and should count - any scored in a penalty shoot out (after extra time) should not count.
